to withdraw money from youtrip in malaysia  i need to top up sgd into ny youtrip account then convert the sgd to ringgit first before being able to withdraw is it?
From my personal experience  it doesnâ€™t matter if you converted it  youtrip will take from whichever of the 10 currencies has enough to fulfill the withdrawal.
YouTrip don't support MYR wallet. So it takes from SGD (and other currency wallets if not enough).
If you want a MYR balacne  use wise. Additionally for places that donâ€™t accept Visa  you can link your wise card to TouchnGo wallet and pay with QR code with no fees
ohhhh thank you so much !!!!
Takes time  but I think it's ok to ask repeated as long as it's not brought up too often  especially given how rapid bank change policies these days

YouTrip only have 11 currency wallets so you can "lock in" the rate by converting your currency to the desired currency. Take it like you went to money exchange go change money  but instead of cash  it's in a e-Wallet.For the remaining currencies  it would be on real-time exchange rate. Take it like you're swiping your debit card. But when you swipe your YouTrip card  remember to select local currency (not SGD) so that conversion is done by YouTrip.
